sections.heading: Understanding にちがいない
sections.content:
〜にちがいない expresses very high certainty (90-99%), showing strong conviction based on evidence, logic, or intuition. It's stronger than はずだ and much stronger than だろう.

彼は犯人にちがいない (95% sure based on evidence) "He must be the culprit" 彼は来るはずだ (90% sure based on plan) "He should come" 彼は来るだろう (70% sure, estimation) "He'll probably come"

children.heading: Probability scale
children.content: 30-50%: かもしれない (might) 60-80%: だろう (probably) 85-95%: はずだ (should/expected) 90-99%: にちがいない (must be) 100%: である/だ (is) にちがいない = very high certainty

children.heading: Plain form + にちがいない
children.content: Verbs: 行くにちがいない - must go 行ったにちがいない - must have gone 行かないにちがいない - surely won't go い-adjectives: 高いにちがいない - must be expensive 高かったにちがいない - must have been expensive な-adjectives: 便利にちがいない - must be convenient (No な before にちがいない) Nouns: 学生にちがいない - must be a student 本物にちがいない - must be genuine (No の before にちがいない)

children.heading: Observable evidence
children.content: 電気がついている。誰かいるにちがいない "The light is on. Someone must be there" Based on what you can see/observe Direct evidence

children.heading: Logical deduction
children.content: 彼は医者だ。だから忙しいにちがいない "He's a doctor. So he must be busy" Based on logical reasoning Cause and effect

children.heading: Strong intuition
children.content: 彼は知っているにちがいない "He must know" Based on circumstances and reasoning

children.heading: Past experience
children.content: いつもこの時間に来る。今日も来るにちがいない "He always comes at this time. He must come today too" Based on patterns/history

children.heading: Defending someone
children.content: 彼が嘘をつくにちがいない？ いいえ、彼が嘘をつくはずがない！ "He must be lying?" No, there's no way he's lying!" Strong trust/belief

children.heading: Making accusations
children.content: 犯人はお前にちがいない！ "The culprit must be you!" Strong conviction Can be wrong!

children.heading: Expressing confidence
children.content: この計画は成功するにちがいない "This plan will surely succeed" Confident prediction

children.heading: Detective/Mystery contexts
children.content: 真犯人は彼にちがいない "The real culprit must be him" 犯行時刻は10時にちがいない "The time of the crime must be 10 o'clock" Common in mysteries

children.heading: にちがいない (casual/written)
children.content: 彼は来るにちがいない "He must come" Standard form

children.heading: にちがいありません (polite)
children.content: 彼は来るにちがいありません "He must come" Polite form Formal contexts

children.heading: に相違ない/に相違ありません (very formal)
children.content: 事実に相違ない "There is no doubt it's a fact" Very formal, official Legal documents

children.heading: きっと～にちがいない
children.content: きっと成功するにちがいない "It will surely succeed" Emphasizes certainty Redundant but emphatic

children.heading: 絶対に～にちがいない
children.content: 絶対に彼にちがいない "It absolutely must be him" Maximum emphasis Very strong conviction

children.heading: ～ないにちがいない
children.content: 彼は知らないにちがいない "He must not know" 嘘ではないにちがいない "It must not be a lie" Strong negative conviction

children.heading: Must have done
children.content: 彼は昨日来たにちがいない "He must have come yesterday" そこにあったにちがいない "It must have been there" 見たにちがいありません "You must have seen it" Strong conviction about past

children.heading: Seeking confirmation
children.content: 彼が犯人にちがいないよね？ "He must be the culprit, right?" そうにちがいないでしょう？ "That must be so, right?" Seeking agreement

sections.heading: にちがいない vs はずだ

children.heading: にちがいない - Personal conviction
children.content: 彼は来るにちがいない "He must come" (I'm very confident) Based on: - Strong belief - Evidence - Intuition Personal certainty

children.heading: はずだ - Logical expectation
children.content: 彼は来るはずだ "He should come" (according to plan) Based on: - Plans - Rules - Logic Objective expectation

children.heading: Example comparison
children.content: 彼は知っているにちがいない "He must know" (I'm sure he knows) 彼は知っているはずだ "He should know" (it's reasonable he knows) Different basis for certainty

children.heading: Shows strong feeling
children.content: 愛は存在するにちがいない！ "Love must exist!" 努力は報われるにちがいない！ "Effort must be rewarded!" Emotional conviction Passionate belief

children.heading: Dramatic effect
children.content: 真実は必ず明らかになるにちがいない "The truth will surely be revealed" 運命がそうさせたにちがいない "Fate must have made it so" Dramatic, emphatic

children.heading: Overusing for trivial matters
children.content: Unnatural: 今日は月曜日にちがいない ⚠️ Natural: 今日は月曜日だ ✓ Don't use for obvious facts Reserve for uncertain matters

children.heading: Wrong particle
children.content: Wrong: にちがいある ❌ Right: にちがいない ✓ Must use ない (negative)

children.heading: Slightly less forceful
children.content: Direct: 彼にちがいない Softer: 彼にちがいないと思う "I think it must be him" Adds slight hedge

sections.heading: にちがいないのだ (Emphatic)
sections.content: これが答えにちがいないのだ "This must be the answer (I tell you)" 犯人は彼にちがいないのです "The culprit must be him" Emphatic conclusion

children.heading: News/Reports
children.content: この現象は温暖化の影響にちがいない "This phenomenon must be the effect of global warming" 事故の原因は整備不良にちがいない "The cause of the accident must be poor maintenance" Strong editorial stance

children.heading: Personal convictions
children.content: 夢は叶うにちがいない "Dreams must come true" 正義は勝つにちがいない "Justice must prevail" Idealistic beliefs

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 彼は知っているにちがいない "He must know" これは本物にちがいありません "This must be genuine" 犯人は彼にちがいない "The culprit must be him"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 彼女は一生懸命勉強している。 合格するにちがいない "She's studying very hard. She must pass" この計画は完璧だ。 成功するにちがいありません "This plan is perfect. It must succeed" 靴がない。出かけたにちがいない "The shoes are gone. He must have gone out"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 彼の表情を見れば分かる。何か隠している にちがいない。嘘をついている目だ。 真実を知っているにちがいないが、 話したくないようだ。 "If you look at his expression, you can tell. He must be hiding something. Those are the eyes of someone lying.
